response.answer_text: Manufacturing is the making of a product or part of a product that goes to make the end product. For example a company can make solenoids for cars and they are manufacturing solenoids. or a company can make the car, the end product, using parts that have been manufactured by another company (like the solenoids made by the above company) and they are manufacturing cars.

Well in Latin Manu means hand. ie. Manual labor is labor by hand not machines. The verb Facere in Latin means to make. So manufacture means, in Latin (Roman bronze age terms) to make or craft by hand. Our family motto on my mother’s side is Mente et Manu. That means “with mind and hands.” As opposed to harvesting fishing, or mining. Manufacturing means making things. Tools have improved since Roman times, and so have processes, and the amount of hand work is minimal.
